24.name: Parsnip
24.description: A spring tuber closely related to the carrot. It has an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

seed.name: Parsnip Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

188.name: Green Bean
188.description: A juicy little bean with a cool, crisp snap.

seed.name: Bean Starter
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Yields multiple beans per harvest. Grows on a trellis.

190.name: Cauliflower
190.description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

seed.name: Cauliflower Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 12 days to produce a large cauliflower.

seed.name: Potato Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature, and has a chance of yielding multiple potatoes at harvest.

248.name: Garlic
248.description: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

seed.name: Garlic Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

250.name: Kale
250.description: The waxy leaves are great in soups and stir frys.

seed.name: Kale Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.

252.name: Rhubarb
252.description: The stalks are extremely tart, but make a great dessert when sweetened.

seed.name: Rhubarb Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 13 days to mature.

seed.name: Melon Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 12 days to mature.

256.name: Tomato
256.description: Rich and slightly tangy, the Tomato has a wide variety of culinary uses.

seed.name: Tomato Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

258.name: Blueberry
258.description: A popular berry reported to have many health benefits. The blue skin has the highest nutrient concentration.

seed.name: Blueberry Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

260.name: Hot Pepper
260.description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

seed.name: Pepper Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

262.name: Wheat
262.description: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

seed.name: Wheat Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.

264.name: Radish
264.description: A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

seed.name: Radish Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 6 days to mature.

266.name: Red Cabbage
266.description: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The color can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.

seed.name: Red Cabbage Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 9 days to mature.

268.name: Starfruit
268.description: An extremely juicy fruit that grows in hot, humid weather. Slightly sweet with a sour undertone.

seed.name: Starfruit Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature.

270.name: Corn
270.description: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favorite.

seed.name: Corn Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 14 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

272.name: Eggplant
272.description: A rich and wholesome relative of the tomato. Delicious fried or stewed.

seed.name: Eggplant Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

274.name: Artichoke
274.description: The bud of a thistle plant. The spiny outer leaves conceal a fleshy, filling interior.

seed.name: Artichoke Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 8 days to mature.

276.name: Pumpkin
276.description: A fall favorite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavored flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a festive decoration.

seed.name: Pumpkin Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 13 days to mature.

278.name: Bok Choy
278.description: The leafy greens and fibrous stalks are healthy and delicious.

seed.name: Bok Choy Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 4 days to mature.

280.name: Yam
280.description: A starchy tuber with a lot of culinary versatility.

seed.name: Yam Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to mature.

282.name: Cranberries
282.description: These tart red berries are a traditional winter food.

seed.name: Cranberry Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

284.name: Beet
284.description: A sweet and earthy root vegatable. As a bonus, the leaves make a great salad.

seed.name: Beet Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 6 days to mature.

300.name: Amaranth
300.description: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilization.

seed.name: Amaranth Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to grow. Harvest with the scythe.

304.name: Hops
304.description: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavor beer.

seed.name: Hops Starter
seed.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

376.name: Poppy
376.description: In addition to its colorful flower, the Poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.

seed.name: Poppy Seeds
seed.description: Plant in summer. Produces a bright red flower in 7 days.

seed.name: Grape Starter
seed.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

400.name: Strawberry
400.description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

seed.name: Strawberry Seeds
seed.description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature, and keeps producing strawberries after that.

417.name: Sweet Gem Berry
417.description: It's by far the sweetest thing you've ever smelled.

seed.name: Rare Seed
seed.description: Sow in fall. Takes all season to grow.

421.name: Sunflower
421.description: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.

seed.name: Sunflower Seeds
seed.description: Plant in summer or fall. Takes 8 days to produce a large sunflower. Yields more seeds at harvest.

433.name: Coffee Bean
433.description: Plant in spring or summer to grow a coffee plant. Place five beans in a keg to make coffee.

seed.name: Coffee Bean
seed.description: Plant in spring or summer to grow a coffee plant. Place five beans in a keg to make coffee.

seed.name: Ancient Seeds
seed.description: Could these still grow?

591.name: Tulip
591.description: The most popular spring flower. Has a very faint sweet smell.

seed.name: Tulip Bulb
seed.description: Plant in spring. Takes 6 days to produce a colorful flower. Assorted colors.

593.name: Summer Spangle
593.description: A tropical bloom that thrives in the humid summer air. Has a sweet, tangy aroma.

seed.name: Spangle Seeds
seed.description: Plant in summer. Takes 8 days to produce a vibrant tropical flower. Assorted colors.

595.name: Fairy Rose
595.description: An old folk legend suggests that the sweet smell of this flower attracts fairies.

seed.name: Fairy Seeds
seed.description: Plant in fall. Takes 12 days to produce a mysterious flower. Assorted Colors.

597.name: Blue Jazz
597.description: The flower grows in a sphere to invite as many butterflies as possible.

seed.name: Jazz Seeds
seed.description: Plant in spring. Takes 7 days to produce a blue puffball flower.
